did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Directors correspondence and subject files of the Commission on Population Growth and Development, 1967-1995 (bulk 1989-1994)
did.origination: Virginia. General Assembly. Commission on Population Growth and Development.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Commission on Population Growth and Development. Directors correspondence and subject files, 1967-1995 (bulk 1989-1994). Accessions 35064, 35772, 36388, 50419. State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Commission on Population Growth and Development, Richmond, Va., 30 March 1995 [Acc. 35064].
Transferred from the Division of Legislative Services, General Assembly Building, Richmond, Va. 23219, 2 April 1998 [Acc. 35772].
Transferred from the Commission on Population Growth and Development, Richmond, Va., 8 March 1999 [Acc. 36388].
Transferred from unknown, Retrospective accessioning, 25 May 2012 [Acc. 50419].

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection has been processed using minimal processing standards. The original arrangement has been maintained, the container list is brief and simple, and the records have not been refoldered and fasteners have not been removed.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Commission on Population Growth and Development was established by House Joint Resolution No. 435 during the 1989 General Assembly Session to evaluate and recommend a statewide planning process for population growth and development in Virginia to the year 2020. The Commission was established in response to a recommendation by the Year 2020 Panel that each state participating in the Chesapeake Bay Agreement develop ways to implement the recommendations contained in the Panel's report according to its legislative, executive and budgetary commitments and priorities. This Year 2020 Panel was established as part of the Chesapeake Bay Agreement of 1987 to study the consequences of population growth and development on the Chesapeake Bay watershed.

The Commission on Population Growth and Development was established to study and evaluate the consequences of present and anticipated changes in population and patterns of development on the economic vitality and environmental health of all regions of the Commonwealth. The Commission was also charged with developing initiatives to ensure that adequate planning, coordination, and data dissemination occur at all levels of government, with recommending alternatives for meeting funding requirements, with proposing innovative and cooperative land management techniques, and with examining and evaluating methods of coordinating the activities of the General Assembly and state agencies as they relate to population growth and development.

The Commission was composed of thirty-three members representing the Virginia General Assembly, local and regional government, and citizens at large and was to report annually its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly. The provisions of the chapter expired on June 30, 1995 when the Commission was not extended by the General Assembly. The chairman of the commission was Delegate Tayloe W. Murphy, Jr., and the executive director of the commission was Katherine Imhoff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 1967-1995 (bulk 1989-1994), of the Commission on Population Growth and Development. Includes clippings, correspondence, faxes, House and Senate documents, meeting minutes, publications, public meetings and participant comments, reports, speeches, subject files, surveys, and other materials. The collection is arranged into four series by accession number and has been processed using minimal processing standards.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: Series I: Directors correspondence and subject files [Acc. 35064]
Series II: Directors correspondence and subject files [Acc. 35772]
Series III: Directors correspondence and subject files [Acc. 36388]
Series IV: Directors correspondence and subject files [Acc. 50419]

did.unittitle: Series I: Directors correspondence and subject files [Acc. 35064], 1989-1994

scopecontent.p: This series includes correspondence, faxes, historical documents, and participation meeting files.

did.unittitle: Subseries 1: Public Education and Participation Meetings, 1991 October

scopecontent.p: Open public education and participation meetings on "the Challenge of Growth" were coordinated by the Commission on Population Growth and Development to inform citizens of future trends and the work of the Commission, and to give citizens the opportunity to express their opinions on a variety of issues. This subseries documents these public meetings and include correspondence, planning documentation, informational papers, new releases, memorandums, schedules, and Virginia Visions Worksheets, which were comment forms completed by meeting participants.
